頂.definition: apex; crown of the head; top; roof; most; to carry on the head; to push to the top; to go against; to replace; to substitute; to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc); (slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile; classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

頂上.definition: on top of; at the summit

頂住.definition: to withstand; to stand up to

頂冒.definition: abbr. for 頂名冒姓|顶名冒姓[ding3 ming2 mao4 xing4]

頂刊.definition: top-tier academic journal (abbr. for 頂級期刊|顶级期刊[ding3ji2 qi1kan1])

頂包.definition: to serve as forced labor; to take the rap for sb

頂名冒姓.definition: to pretend to be sb else

頂嘴.definition: to talk back; to answer back

頂天立地.definition: lit. able to support both heaven and earth; of indomitable spirit (idiom)

頂尖.definition: peak; apex; world best; number one; finest (competitors); top (figures in a certain field)

頂尖兒.definition: erhua variant of 頂尖|顶尖[ding3 jian1]

頂層.definition: top floor; the top of a building

頂峰.definition: peak; summit; fig. high point; masterpiece

頂崗.definition: to replace sb on a workshift; to substitute for

頂戴.definition: cap badge (official sign of rank in Qing dynasty)

頂拜.definition: to prostrate oneself; to kneel and bow the head (in submission, supplication, worship etc)

頂擋.definition: to resist; to obstruct; to bear responsibility for

頂會.definition: top-tier academic conference (abbr. for 頂級會議|顶级会议[ding3ji2 hui4yi4])

頂板.definition: roof; roof plate; rock layer forming roof of a cave or mine; abacus

頂格.definition: (typesetting) to not indent; to set the text flush with the left (or top) margin

頂棒.definition: bucking bar (metal bar fixing the tail of a rivet as it is driven)

頂樓.definition: top floor; attic; loft; garret; penthouse; (flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)

頂流.definition: (slang) top-tier celebrity or influencer (abbr. for 頂級流量|顶级流量[ding3ji2 liu2liang4])

頂燈.definition: dome light (of a taxi etc); ceiling light (in a room); interior light (of a car); light on the top of a mast etc

頂牛兒.definition: to push with the forehead; to lock horns; to be at loggerheads

頂班.definition: to take over sb else's job; to substitute for

頂盤.definition: to buy a struggling business and keep it going; to take over a business

頂禮膜拜.definition: to prostrate oneself in worship (idiom); (fig.) to worship; to bow down to

頂缸.definition: to take the blame; to be a scapegoat; to carry the can

頂罪.definition: to take the blame for sb else; to compensate for one's crime; to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)

頂芽.definition: terminal bud (growing at the tip of a plant)

頂補.definition: to fill a vacancy; to substitute for

頂角.definition: angle at apex; summit angle; cusp

頂讓.definition: (Tw) to hand over (a business etc) for an agreed price

頂輪.definition: sahasrāra or sahasrara, the crown or fontanel chakra 查克拉, residing at the top of the skull

頂部.definition: roof; topmost part; top (of tree, wall etc); apex

頂配.definition: highest level of specification (for a product)

頂頭.definition: to come directly towards one; top; immediate (superior)

頂風.definition: to face into the wind; against the wind; fig. against the law

頂颳颳.definition: variant of 頂呱呱|顶呱呱[ding3 gua1 gua1]
